97556.name: Numbers of days off (Huberman and Minns (2007))
97556.description: Number of days off (in vacation and holidays) over the twentieth century. The New World includes Europe, the United States, Australia, and Canada while the Old World consists of all other countries included in Huberman and Minns's sample. The 'Old World (weighted)' and 'New World (weighted)' series are population weighted averages.

source.dataPublishedBy: Huberman, M. and Minns, C., 2007. The times they are not changin’: Days and hours of work in Old and New Worlds, 1870–2000. Explorations in Economic History, 44(4), pp.538-567.

source.additionalInfo:
The New World includes Europe, the United States, Australia, and Canada while the Old World consists of all other countries included in Huberman and Minns's sample. The 'Old World (weighted)' and 'New World (weighted)' series are population weighted averages.
